item.title: Car parked in far from kerb, 15th January
item.description:
The vehicle has been there for 2 days but is jutting out and parked poorly.The registration is DG59CVY which is taxed and tested but appears abandoned.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Draycot Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Inadequate drain, 15th January
item.description:
Every time there is heavy or continuous rain the drainage system cannot cope. This has been reported several times but there has been no change It is difficult to get out of my house on foot due to the flooding and the effect of cars driving through the excess water
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Shurdington Road, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole - entrance to Charlton Kings Carehome, 15th January
item.description:
I have hit this twice in the dark, as not clearly visible when it had rained and full of rain water - it will do some car damage if hit awkwardly, very deep
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Road, Cheltenham

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 15th January
item.description:

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Difficulty to use path due to cars parked and bins and rubbish left out permanently, 15th January
item.description:
This stretch of path is difficult to pass with a mobility scooter and prams due to vehicles parked on the pavement and recycling and rubbish (bin and suitcase) and bins permanently stored on the verge belonging to 106 Welch Road. The recycling lids and contents often blow over the path. This has been ongoing for several months and has been previously reported. Residents should store their bins and recycling within their property boundary. This is a very busy pavement used by children going to school and families with young children and pushchairs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 108, Welch Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: In subway - human excrement & various items, 15th January
item.description:

item.description:

item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Multiple pot holes in this area and road breaking up on one side, 15th January
item.description:
Road as you turn into Gotherington fields white wall round Four Winds GL52 9SB road collapsing into lay-by opposite this property. Then next to Four Winds property as you turn up a private drive way to Grasson and The Patch the road had a big pot hole in it could be as deeper than golf ball and definitely rounded than a dinner plate. Other pot holes as you go up the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gotherington Fields, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road degradation, 15th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 15th January
item.description:
Customer reporting heavy flooding issues on Cold Pool Lane that have now become a regular issue whenever it rains, making it impassable for vehicles. Asking if grips can be re-cut or cleared, as surface water also freezes in cold weather, causing incidents.
Report on FixMyStreet
